RamayanaScenes.description: King Dasharatha of Ayodhya performs a sacred ritual to have children, leading to the birth of four sons: Rama, Bharata, Lakshmana, and Shatrughna.
Sage Vishwamitra seeks Rama's help to protect his rituals from demons. Dasharatha hesitantly agrees, and Rama, accompanied by Lakshmana, goes with the sage.
Rama participates in Sita's Swayamvara, where he lifts and breaks the divine bow of Shiva, winning her hand in marriage.
Queen Kaikeyi invokes two boons from King Dasharatha, exiling Rama to the forest for 14 years and placing her son Bharata on the throne.
Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana live peacefully in the forest until Shurpanakha, a demoness, tries to attack Sita. Lakshmana cuts off her nose.
Ravana, seeking revenge, disguises himself as a sage and abducts Sita while Rama and Lakshmana are away.
Rama forms an alliance with the monkey king Sugriva, who promises to help find Sita in exchange for Rama's help in defeating his brother Vali.
Hanuman crosses the ocean to reach Lanka, where he finds Sita in Ravana's captivity and assures her of Rama's rescue plan.
Rama and his army of monkeys and bears wage a fierce battle against Ravana's forces to rescue Sita.
In a climactic battle, Rama kills Ravana with the help of the celestial weapon Brahmastra, ending the war.
After the victory in Lanka and Sita's rescue, Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana return to Ayodhya, where Rama is crowned king.
